title: Calories in Pasta
meta_description: Discover calories in pasta per 100 g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Cooked plain spaghetti pasta from durum wheat semolina, boiled without salt or oil; drained.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pasta type, brand, cooking method, portion size, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked plain pasta provides ~131 kcal and ~25 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of cooked pasta?
faqs.a: About 131 kcal for plain cooked pasta.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in pasta per serving?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g carbs per 100 g cooked, mostly from starch.

faqs.q: Does dry pasta have more calories than cooked?
faqs.a: Yes, dry pasta is ~371 kcal per 100 g; cooking adds water, reducing density.
Moderate at ~5.2 g per 100 g cooked; pair with meat or beans for more.

faqs.q: How do different pasta shapes affect calories?
faqs.a: Calories are similar per weight; shapes mainly affect cooking time and portion perception.
